remarks: A version of ~ axdc4 that works on an upper set of integers instead of ` _om ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Jan-2014.)
statement:
axdc4uz.1 $e |- M e. ZZ $.
axdc4uz.2 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
axdc4uz $p |- ( ( A e. V /\ C e. A /\ F : ( Z X. A ) --> ( ~P A \ { (/) } ) ) -> E. g ( g : Z --> A /\ ( g ` M ) = C /\ A. k e. Z ( g ` ( k + 1 ) ) e. ( k F ( g ` k ) ) ) ) $.
$d A g k $.
$d C g $.
$d F g k $.
$d M g k $.
$d Z g $.
